outputs.output_descr: Capacity of rule of law institutions strengthened: capacity of Ministry of Justice reviewed and strengthened; support to the Ministry of Justice to the lead the implementation of the National Justice Sector Strategy provided; implementation of the 'Justice for the Future' project ensured; development and implementation of legal aid strategy supported; legislative drafting skills enhanced; public awareness on the Ministry's work raised and access to relevant legal information by the public enhanced; and capacity of the Attorney-General's Office and the High Judicial Council strengthened.

Access to justice at local and grassroots levels enhanced: legal aid services provided and strengthened, particularly for the poor and the disadvantaged; legal literacy amongst rights-holders and duty-bearers improved; accountability mechanisms put in place; human rights advocacy promoted; models for potential linkages between formal and informal justice systems reviewed and developed.

.Gender and juvenile justice improved: legislation related to gender justice and its enforcement reviewed; formulation and adoption of a national youth policy supported in partnership with others; gender and juvenile justice strategy and action plan developed; and capacity of law enforcement and legal professionals on gender justice developed.

Rule of law in the Gaza Strip initiated: legal aid services provided and strengthened, particularly for the poor and disadvantaged; capacity of PNA judges and prosecutors in Gaza reviewed and strengthened; legal literacy amongst rights-holders and duty-bearers improved; accountability mechanisms put in place; human rights advocacy promoted.
outputs.output_title: Rule of Law in the Gaza Strip

outputs.output_descr: Confidence-building among stakeholders promoted: dialogue and networking promoted; supply of and demand for justice monitored and analyzed; programme outputs monitored and evaluated.

The proposed Courthouse will be erected on a land lot of about 6,000 square meters located in Hebron City. 
The overall proposed Hebron Courthouse will house the First Instance, Magistrate and Appeal courts, Public Prosecution Service and the Judicial Police Services in a facility with a gross floor area of approximately 15,400 square meters.
Internal police accountability strengthened; national anti-corruption efforts strengthened; and civilian oversight strengthened.

project_descr: Supporting the Rule of Law and Access to Justice
project_title: Supporting the Rule of Law and Access to Justice

subnational.name: Ministry of Social Affairs, Ramallah City
